metadata.title: CVE-2024-49995 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:tipc: guard against string buffer overrunSmatch reports that copying media_name and if_name to name_parts mayoverwrite the destination. .../bearer.c:166 bearer_name_validate() error: strcpy() 'media_name' toolarge for 'name_parts->media_name' (32 vs 16) .../bearer.c:167 bearer_name_validate() error: strcpy() 'if_name' toolarge for 'name_parts->if_name' (1010102 vs 16)This does seem to be the case so guard against this possibility by usingstrscpy() and failing if truncation occurs.Introduced by commit b97bf3fd8f6a ("[TIPC] Initial merge")Compile tested only.
